intro: Eschweilera rankiniae, commonly known as the Rankin's ceiba, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a large tree that can grow up to 40 meters tall, characterized by its buttressed roots and smooth, grey bark. The plant produces showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds covered in a sticky, fleshy coating. Eschweilera rankiniae plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing shelter and food for numerous wildlife species.
